translated: Alströmer, Jonas Magnus, Baron, former envoy, chamberlain, Naddö, Vadstena, born on August 21, 1877 in Lunda, Södermani. Firstborn of Jonas A. and Sigrid Björkenheim. Married twice: firstly, with Rigmor Tvermoes for 21 years, and secondly, with Adine Peyron in her second marriage for 36 years. He obtained a law degree from Uppsala University in 1903 and worked as a clerk at the Court of Appeal from 1903-1906, then as an assistant in the Department of Agriculture from 1906. In 1907, he was assigned as acting domain fish inspector, followed by his appointment as second secretary in the Ministry of Foreign Affairs in 1908, first secretary in 1912, acting head of department in 1914, acting Legation Counsellor in Paris in 1917, Legation Counsellor in London in 1919, Ministry of Foreign Affairs Commissioner and head of personnel and administrative department in 1921, envoy to Bern in 1922, also to Vienna and Budapest in 1923, acting envoy to Bucharest, Athens, and Belgrade in 1925 and Ministry of Foreign Affairs Director in 1933. He represented the Swedish Red Cross at the Portsmouth Conference in 1920 and was a member of the international commission for the treatment of prisoners of war from 1920 to 1921. He served as delegate to the London Conference on the publication of an international catalog of scientific literature in 1920, delegate to the League of Nations conference in Geneva in 1923 and in 1925, and representative to the negotiating committees with Greece in 1926 and with Romania in 1930-1931, as well as the negotiations with Greece regarding shipping certificates in 1928-1929 and clearing agreements in 1932. He was appointed chamberlain in 1914 and owned Naddö Estate in Östergötland, with decorations including the Order of the Seraphim, the Order of the North Star, the Order of Vasa, the Order of Dannebrog, the Order of the Crown of Italy, the Order of the Star of Romania, and the Hungarian Order of Saint Stephen, among others. He was an honorary citizen of Nauplion in Greece.

memberOf.name: Honorary citizen of Nauplion in Greece
